intro: Karpatiosorbus paxiana, commonly known as the Carpathian rowan, is a deciduous shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces red berries in the fall, which are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Karpatiosorbus paxiana typically grows in rocky or forested areas and is adapted to temperate climates. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
